com.pb.sawdust.util.array

Class FloatTypeSafeArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.util.array.FloatTypeSafeArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TypeSafeArray<java.lang.Float>

    public class FloatTypeSafeArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements TypeSafeArray<java.lang.Float>
    The FloatTypeSafeArray provides a type safe wrapper for (possibly multidimensional) float arrays. Though this class implements TypeSafeArray<Float>, efficiencies will be had if method using primitive floats (instead of object Floats) are used.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • FloatTypeSafeArray

        public FloatTypeSafeArray(java.lang.Object array)
        Constructor specifying the array to wrap. The wrapped array may be multidimensional.
        Parameters:
        array - The array to wrap.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is not a float array.

    • Method Detail

      • getArray

        public java.lang.Object getArray()
        Get the array wrapped by this instance. The returned array will be a primitive float array, not an object Float array.
        Specified by:
        getArray in interface TypeSafeArray<java.lang.Float>
        Returns:
        the wrapped array.

      • getArrayDimensions

        public int getArrayDimensions()
        Description copied from interface: TypeSafeArray
        Get the number of dimensions in the wrapped array.
        Specified by:
        getArrayDimensions in interface TypeSafeArray<java.lang.Float>
        Returns:
        the dimension count of the wrapped array.

      • get

        public float get(int... indices)
        Get the value of the wrapped array at a specified location.
        Parameters:
        indices - The (0-based) location in the array.
        Returns:
        the value at indices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of indices does not match the number of dimensions of the wrapped array (i.e. if indices.length != getArrayDimensions()).
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any index in indices is less than zero or greater than or equal to the size of the wrapped array in the corresponding dimension.

      • getUltimateArray

        public float[] getUltimateArray(int... indices)
        Get the "last" single-dimensional array in the wrapped array at a specified position. The indices parameter specifies an array location in all but the last dimension of the wrapped array; the returned array contains the array elements at that position.
        Parameters:
        indices - The location of the "ultimate" array.
        Returns:
        the array elements at indices.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of indices is not equal to one less than the dimension count of the wrapped array (i.e. if indices.length != getArrayDimensions()-1).
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any index in indices is less than zero or greater than or equal to the size of the wrapped array in the corresponding dimension.

      • set

        public void set(float value,
       int... indices)
        Set the value of the wrapped array at a specified location.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to place in the array.
        indices - The (0-based) location in the array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of indices does not match the number of dimensions of the wrapped array (i.e. if indices.length != getArrayDimensions()).
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if any index in indices is less than zero or greater than or equal to the size of the wrapped array in the corresponding dimension.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.Float getValue(int... indices)
        Description copied from interface: TypeSafeArray
        Get the value of the wrapped array at a specified location. Each index in the indices parameter corresponds to a location in the wrapped array's dimensions.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface TypeSafeArray<java.lang.Float>
        Parameters:
        indices - The (0-based) location in the array.
        Returns:
        the value at indices.
